net.sf.jclal.util.dataset

Class LuceneIndexToWekaDataSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.jclal.util.dataset.LuceneIndexToWekaDataSet

  • public class LuceneIndexToWekaDataSet
extends java.lang.Object
    It converts a Lucene index file to a weka file, the document indexes must have fields called "class" and "content". WARNING: The fields must not contain any punctuation sign. The Instances are SparseInstance.
    Author:
    Oscar Gabriel Reyes Pupo, Maria del Carmen Rodriguez Hernandez, Eduardo Perez Perdomo

    • Method Detail

      • convertLuceneToWekaClassification

        public weka.core.Instances convertLuceneToWekaClassification(java.lang.String wekaFileName,
                                                             java.lang.String indexFile)
                                                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                             java.io.IOException
        It converts a index file of Lucene to a arff weka file for classification. The weka file class are nominal. The classifiers will work with nominal class.
        Parameters:
        wekaFileName - Path of weka file.
        indexFile - Path of index file based on Lucene. The document indexes must have fields called "class" and "content". WARNING: The fields must not contains any puntuaction sign.
        Returns:
        Instances of weka. The instances are sparse since it is about text information.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file does not exists.
        java.io.IOException - If happens a error while writing the file.

      • convertLuceneToWekaRegression

        public weka.core.Instances convertLuceneToWekaRegression(java.lang.String wekaFileName,
                                                         java.lang.String indexFile)
                                                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                         java.io.IOException
        It converts a index file of Lucene to a arff weka file for regression. The weka file class are real. The used classifiers will work with numeric real classe.
        Parameters:
        wekaFileName - Path of weka file.
        indexFile - Path of index file based on Lucene. The document indexes must have fields called "class" and "content". WARNING: The fields must not contains any puntuaction sign.
        Returns:
        Instances of weka. The instances are sparse since it is about text information.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file does not exists.
        java.io.IOException - If happens a error while writing the file.

        Close the file readers
        Parameters:

        Test if a Weka dataset was created satisfactorily
        Parameters:
        wekaFileName - The name of the Weka dataset.
        Returns:
        The instances.
